page.title: 10BROCKWEIR VILLAGE HISTORY
page.content: The village of Brockweir was part of the land owned by the monks of Tintern Abbey.A roadway known as Monk's Way linked it to Tintern where there was a ferry crossing.The village has buildi- ngs of many different ages scattered over the hillsides and linked by narr- ow lanes.Only one of the houses, Box Cottage remains unchanged,the rest have been renovated and extended. Brockweir was an important inland port as the River Wye is tidal as far as Bigsweir.It was a route to Chepstow one of the largest local ports.There were many barges or trows carrying goods up and down the river.It had sixteen cider houses,today there is one pub.When the railway opened in 1876 the river traffic ceased.Today the river is used mainly by fishermen and canoeists.
